meanings.definition: More cunning or sly than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The fox was the cunninger of the two animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The cat became even cunninger after observing the raccoon's tricks.
meanings.sent3: The cunninger squirrel managed to steal all the nuts from the tree without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes gleamed with a cunninger sparkle as she plotted her next move.
meanings.sent5: The cunninger detective solved the mystery in record time.

meanings.definition: Showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion.
meanings.sent1: The cunninger spy managed to infiltrate the enemy base undetected.
meanings.sent2: The magician's cunninger tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The cunninger student managed to sneak out of class without the teacher noticing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as cunninger as a fox's when she outsmarted her opponent.
meanings.sent5: The cunninger thief left no trace of his presence at the crime scene.
